required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: RCT Evaluating Standardized Counseling on Early Discontinuation for Irregular Bleeding in Nexplanon Users
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Control Trial Evaluating Impact of Standardized Counseling on Early Discontinuation for Irregular Bleeding in Users of the Contraceptive Implant

lead_sponsor.agency: Planned Parenthood of the St. Louis Region and Southwest Missouri

clinical_study.source: Planned Parenthood of the St. Louis Region and Southwest Missouri

brief_summary.textblock: Clinician counseling for implant users should involve an explanation of the likelihood of irregular bleeding and the possibility of continued or frequent bleeding throughout three years of use. If that counseling does not provide specifics of the actual distribution of bleeding patterns described in published literature, there remains the real possibility of biased or directed counseling, leading to an inaccurate and exaggerated expectation of potential bleeding changes. This study aims to evaluate if a standardized script accompanied by a visual aid regarding expected bleeding profiles, with intention to remove any possibility of negative or positive framing, could change users' expectations and satisfaction with their method, leading to lower discontinuation rates.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 1:1 fashion with block sizes of 8 using a computer-generated random allocation
study_design_info.masking_description: All study team members will be blinded to the randomization, with the exception of the research member who will be delivering the counseling.

primary_outcome.description: Based subjects' self-reported ability to cope with various changes in bleeding patterns, and other demographic information, we will analyze whether an association exists between those who discontinue their method use early due to troublesome bleeding and the counseling they received on the day of method insertion.

intervention.description: Research staff will follow a script designed to give unbiased, medically accurate information regarding bleeding changes that may occur with use of a contraceptive ENG implant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presenting at the health center to receive an etonogestrel-releasing subdermal implant (Nexplanon) for primarily contraceptive benefits
- Ability to consent in English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have used an etonogestrel-releasing subdermal implant (Nexplanon) within the 12 weeks prior to enrollment

eligibility.gender_description: Cis-gendered females; Assigned female at birth and not using hormone therapy

overall_official.affiliation: Planned Parenthood of the St. Louis Region and Southwest Missouri

facility.name: Planned Parenthood of the St. Louis Region and Southwest Missouri
